pull.title: Remove redundant code in MutateTxSign(CMutableTransaction&, const std::string&)
pull.body: Remove redundant code in `MutateTxSign(CMutableTransaction&, const std::string&)`.

events.body:
So do we really not care if the resulting signed transaction is complete or not?
(if we do, this a bug instead of redundant code)
@laanwj Yes, I agree it looks odd :-)
What should we do about this one? Shall I close? :-)
Needs rebase due to travis bug

events.message: Remove redundant code in MutateTxSign(CMutableTransaction&, const std::string&)

events.body: What shall we do about this one? Leaving dead code around feels icky :-)

> What shall we do about this one? Leaving dead code around feels icky :-)

No one really answered my question. Do we care about this incompleteness? Should it be in the output?
I never use bitcoin-tx myself so I can't answer it.

@practicalswift: care to elaborate why this is dead code?
I haven't check all possible states, but for me it looks like that `VerifyScript()` after combining signatures and updated the transaction makes pretty sense... but maybe I miss something.

Pushed an updated version which only removes trivial dead code. Now keeping the `VerifyScript(…)` call and its side-effects (if any).

Thanks for reviewing @jonasschnelli 

Please re-review :-)

This seems to make sense now.
utACK 347fd7ca1742183707541ef186f97218aab6e0a9
@jonasschnelli Would you mind re-reviewing? Had to force push to get Travis to rebuild :-)  No changes since 347fd7c.

Updated version. Please re-review :-)

@jonasschnelli - did I misunderstand you regarding the call to `VerifyScript()`? As @MarcoFalke  commented there seems to be no side-effects from it and the return value is not used so no need to keep it around? What am I missing? :-)
The current commit is now identical to the original commit (b1149ee). I'd prefer you force push b1149ee, so I don't have to re-ACK. ;)

comments.body: The return code is ignored and you are only passing const references. Mind to elaborate on the side effects this has?
